title: >>> A YOUTHFUL Tryout
body_text:
For the past year, the great sport of dodgeball has seen legends come and go. Through the journey however have remained several of the league's most honored stars. Those very stars were challenged, perhaps for one night only, by an array of hungry, talented youngsters known as Wall High School Freshman.
------->> MAX O'RIELLY vs. ROBERT BROWN
DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE had already started out as an unusual event as the most random of players were chosen as the night's captains.
For the undefeated Robert Brown, his dodgeball days have seemingly returned after a long hiatus away from the sport. On the first April 2006 event, DODGEBALL 33, he defeated Darien Brown in captain's competition, billed as "Brown vs. Brown". Max on the other had yet to even lead a team into battle. Either way, someone was walking away undefeated!
After teams were assembled, Max's fellow allies were openly confident, even arrogant for that matter. The outcome of the first four games gave them something to brag about as the score read 4 to 0 in favor of the unexperienced captain. But once the WHS Freshman entered the courts [and veteran Chris Adams], games not only got quicker and more intense but the score itself would alter.
Perhaps the highlight of the event came from the "invading" Freshman. Fearless in their attempts to destroy, those serving as Robert's allies unknowingly saved him from an embarrassing defeat. The score at exactly 10:37 read 4-4, leaving room for one more game. It was winner-take-all in the finale of DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE.
Few eliminations were earned on either side in the opening minutes. But a huge mistake was made when Chris Adams inadvertantly deflected an enemy ball into ally Kevin Fitzpatrick. Seconds later, Chris himself would fall, thus sending two icons out of the game. Max, along with a full squad in tact, picked-off their opponents one-by-one, lastly eliminating dodging expert Mike Edwards.
Max O'Rielly defeated Robert Brown 5 to 4 at DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE.
------->> AN ALL-STAR LINE-UP
There was such an array of talented athletes and plays that this time around it is very difficult to choose who stood-out among their peers.
I. Even if they play once every four months, it always great to see the brothers Brown, Robert and Matt.
II. If you ever need lessons in dodging, always look to Kevin "Fitz", Tom Adams, and Mike Edwards. These are three outstanding athletes.
III. One has to admire Dan Spengeman who competed during the entire event. It was announced that his repaired finger may need an additional surgery down the road.
IV. Though the newblood came in fearless, two of them certainly went home in pain. For those that remember, two nutshots were delivered at full-force.
------->> THE FIRST RECORDS OF YEAR 2!
- Attendance: 27
- New Players: (8) Andrew D, Chris G, Chris Y, Eric D, Mike S, Ryan D, Steve F, Zach M
- Biggest Returns: Casi Smith (Last played at DODGEBALL 33); Matt Brown (Last played at DODGEBALL 35)
- DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE was the 15th time using the WHS Back Courts. This event included human rims.
- DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE saw the highest number of new players since DODGEBALL 50.
- Max O'Rielly went in as a fresh, unexperienced captain and came out the winner. Robert Brown, though previously undefeated, breaks an even
500
with a 1-1 record.
- Only three women participated at DODGEBALL FIFTY-TWO. That is tied for the second lowest female turnout behind DODGEBALL 45, which only had two.
- There were three players named "Chris" and actually not unsual, three named "Kevin" (Adams, Fitz, Megill). In all, there have been nine "Chris's" that have played dodgeball, setting a new record.
- DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE took place on John Watters's 16th birthday.
**According to statistics, it is believed that dodgeball may have hit its "200th player" at DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE. This will be further researched during the week and an official announcement will be made.**
>>> DODGEBALL 56 ... 6:30pm at WHS! September 16th!
body_html:
For the past year, the great sport of dodgeball has seen legends come and go. Through the journey however have remained several of the league's most honored stars. Those very stars were challenged, perhaps for one night only, by an array of hungry, talented youngsters known as Wall High School Freshman.

------->> MAX O'RIELLY vs. ROBERT BROWN
DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE had already started out as an unusual event as the most random of players were chosen as the night's captains.

For the undefeated Robert Brown, his dodgeball days have seemingly returned after a long hiatus away from the sport. On the first April 2006 event, DODGEBALL 33, he defeated Darien Brown in captain's competition, billed as "Brown vs. Brown". Max on the other had yet to even lead a team into battle. Either way, someone was walking away undefeated!

After teams were assembled, Max's fellow allies were openly confident, even arrogant for that matter. The outcome of the first four games gave them something to brag about as the score read 4 to 0 in favor of the unexperienced captain. But once the WHS Freshman entered the courts [and veteran Chris Adams], games not only got quicker and more intense but the score itself would alter.

Perhaps the highlight of the event came from the "invading" Freshman. Fearless in their attempts to destroy, those serving as Robert's allies unknowingly saved him from an embarrassing defeat. The score at exactly 10:37 read 4-4, leaving room for one more game. It was winner-take-all in the finale of DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE.

Few eliminations were earned on either side in the opening minutes. But a huge mistake was made when Chris Adams inadvertantly deflected an enemy ball into ally Kevin Fitzpatrick. Seconds later, Chris himself would fall, thus sending two icons out of the game. Max, along with a full squad in tact, picked-off their opponents one-by-one, lastly eliminating dodging expert Mike Edwards.

Max O'Rielly defeated Robert Brown 5 to 4 at DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE.

------->> AN ALL-STAR LINE-UP
There was such an array of talented athletes and plays that this time around it is very difficult to choose who stood-out among their peers.

I. Even if they play once every four months, it always great to see the brothers Brown, Robert and Matt.

II. If you ever need lessons in dodging, always look to Kevin "Fitz", Tom Adams, and Mike Edwards. These are three outstanding athletes.

III. One has to admire Dan Spengeman who competed during the entire event. It was announced that his repaired finger may need an additional surgery down the road.

IV. Though the newblood came in fearless, two of them certainly went home in pain. For those that remember, two nutshots were delivered at full-force.

------->> THE FIRST RECORDS OF YEAR 2!
- Attendance: 27
- New Players: (8) Andrew D, Chris G, Chris Y, Eric D, Mike S, Ryan D, Steve F, Zach M
- Biggest Returns: Casi Smith (Last played at DODGEBALL 33); Matt Brown (Last played at DODGEBALL 35)
- DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE was the 15th time using the WHS Back Courts. This event included human rims.
- DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE saw the highest number of new players since DODGEBALL 50.
- Max O'Rielly went in as a fresh, unexperienced captain and came out the winner. Robert Brown, though previously undefeated, breaks an even 500 with a 1-1 record.
- Only three women participated at DODGEBALL FIFTY-TWO. That is tied for the second lowest female turnout behind DODGEBALL 45, which only had two.
- There were three players named "Chris" and actually not unsual, three named "Kevin" (Adams, Fitz, Megill). In all, there have been nine "Chris's" that have played dodgeball, setting a new record.
- DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE took place on John Watters's 16th birthday.

**According to statistics, it is believed that dodgeball may have hit its "200th player" at DODGEBALL FIFTY-FIVE. This will be further researched during the week and an official announcement will be made.**


>>> DODGEBALL 56 ... 6:30pm at WHS! September 16th!
